SENT.plain: The purpose of this study is to report a rare case of primary meningeal high grade Burkitt-type lymphoma presenting as the first clinical manifestation of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome
A 38-year-old Caucasian man, with a negative past medical history, sought treatment after experiencing global headache for five days
CT-Scan revealed a right front-temporo-parietal hyperdense subdural expansive mass
A craniotomy was performed and a hard white subdural was microsurgically dissected
Some hours after the surgery, the patient developed hemispheric cerebral edema and intracranial hypertension syndrome
Decompressive craniotomy was performed and the patient had an excellent recovery
Screening blood tests diagnosed human immunodeficiency virus infection
Further investigation ruled out systemic diseases
Eleven days after the initial surgery, the patient developed an acute respiratory failure and sepsis, dying on that day
